data.text:
Simon Templeman Born: January 28, 1954

Sussex, England, UK Role: Trevor Tomlinson

Simon Templeman (born January 28, 1954; age 70) portrayed Trevor Tomlinson during Season 3 of 24.

Biography and career[]

Templeman was born in Sussex, England. He started his acting career in 1980, with a recurring role in the TV mini-series The Talisman. After that, he has appeared in other TV shows like Star Trek: The Next Generation (with Andreas Katsulas), James Bond Jr., NYPD Blue (with Ricky Schroder and Zach Grenier), ER (with Reiko Aylesworth), and House of Lies.

Aside of TV shows, Templeman has also appeared on films like Black Road, I Am Soldier, The Young Unknowns (with Devon Gummersall), Live Nude Girls, Silent Cries (with Clyde Kusatsu), and The Russia House.

Templeton is more known for his work as a voice actor. Through his career, he has lent his voice to dozens of animated series and video games. His more notable video game role is the titular role on the Legacy of Kain series. Templeton has also worked on Mass Effect, Dragon Age, Diablo, and World of Warcraft.

Templeman has been married to actress Rosalind Chao since 1989. They have two children together.

24 credits[]

"Day 3: 5:00am-6:00am"
